content.description: Sit start with a high left hand hold and a low hand/heel match on the right. Throw to the lip. This is a one-move-wonder lowball.
content.location: This is on the back side of the boulder, opposite the trail. The boulder slopes down to a low arête on the left - sit start there.

content.description: Right Cheek is a pretty small boulder problem, but it is still decent.
content.protection: Crash pads and a small brush for spiders.
content.location: This is to the right of the crack on the side that does not have a tree on it.

content.description: This V8 problem is a very short route that starts off with both hands under the horizontal crack, and from there you go straight up. The few holds on this problem are sharp and very small.
content.location: The problem is on the side of Elephant Rock that faces the trail that enters the woods. There is a tree touching the boulder to the right of the problem.

content.description: Stand start on slopers on the right arête of the tall face of the boulder. Get a high right foot on the low overhanging section. Climb up the arête, and top out at the highest point of the boulder.
content.location: This is on front side of the boulder, right on the trail. This is just left of the big tree that the boulder wraps around and just right of the route Laser Moon Base.

content.description: Elephant Rock is right in the center of Boulder Brook and has a few good problems on it.
